Physics Modules¶

This section details the functions within the various physics modules.

fusion.py¶

fusioncat.physics.fusion.calculate_fusion_power(n_i: Quantity, T_i: Quantity, V: Quantity, fuel: Fuel, ratio: float, reactivity_enhancement_factor: float = 1.0) → tuple[Quantity, Quantity][source]¶

Calculates total fusion power and the power carried by charged particles.

Parameters:

  • n_i (astropy.units.Quantity) – The total ion density.

  • T_i (astropy.units.Quantity) – The ion temperature.

  • V (astropy.units.Quantity) – The plasma volume.

  • fuel (Fuel) – The fusion fuel being used.

  • ratio (float) – The ratio of the first reactant species to the total ion density.

  • reactivity_enhancement_factor (float, optional) – Multiplier for p-B11 reactivity, by default 1.0.

Returns:

A tuple containing: - The total fusion power (p_fusion_total) in Watts. - The power in charged particles (p_charged_particles) in Watts.

Return type:

tuple[astropy.units.Quantity, astropy.units.Quantity]

fusioncat.physics.fusion.calculate_reactivity(fuel: Fuel, T_i: Quantity, enhancement_factor: float = 1.0) → Annotated[Quantity, Unit('m3 / s')][source]¶

Calculates fusion reactivity <sigma*v> using analytical formulas.

This function provides reactivity calculations for several common fusion fuels based on temperature. The formulas are primarily sourced from the NRL Plasma Formulary, providing a standard, citable reference.

Parameters:

  • fuel (Fuel) – The fusion fuel being considered (e.g., FUEL_DT).

  • T_i (astropy.units.Quantity) – The ion temperature, typically in keV.

  • enhancement_factor (float, optional) – A multiplier for the p-B11 reactivity to account for non-Maxwellian effects, by default 1.0.

Returns:

The calculated fusion reactivity in units of m^3/s.

Return type:

astropy.units.Quantity

Raises:

NotImplementedError – If the reactivity formula for the given fuel is not implemented.

radiation.py¶

fusioncat.physics.radiation.calculate_bremsstrahlung_power(n_e: Quantity, T_e: Quantity, z_eff: float) → Quantity[source]¶

Calculates total Bremsstrahlung power density.

Source¶

NRL Plasma Formulary (2019), pg. 60.

param n_e:

The electron density.

type n_e:

astropy.units.Quantity

param T_e:

The electron temperature.

type T_e:

astropy.units.Quantity

param z_eff:

The effective charge of the plasma.

type z_eff:

float

returns:

The Bremsstrahlung power density in W/m^3.

rtype:

astropy.units.Quantity

fusioncat.physics.radiation.calculate_synchrotron_power(n_e: Quantity, T_e: Quantity, B: Quantity, major_radius: Quantity, minor_radius: Quantity, wall_reflectivity: float = 0.9) → Quantity[source]¶

Calculates total synchrotron power loss using the Trubnikov formula for a torus.

Source¶

B.A. Trubnikov, in Reviews of Plasma Physics, Vol. 7 (1979). This is a standard formula for synchrotron emission in a tokamak-like geometry.

param n_e:

Electron density.

type n_e:

astropy.units.Quantity

param T_e:

Electron temperature.

type T_e:

astropy.units.Quantity

param B:

Magnetic field strength.

type B:

astropy.units.Quantity

param major_radius:

The major radius of the torus.

type major_radius:

astropy.units.Quantity

param minor_radius:

The minor radius of the torus.

type minor_radius:

astropy.units.Quantity

param wall_reflectivity:

The fraction of synchrotron power reflected by the vessel wall, by default 0.9.

type wall_reflectivity:

float, optional

returns:

The total synchrotron power loss in Watts.

rtype:

astropy.units.Quantity

fusioncat.physics.radiation.get_ion_species(charge_map: dict[str, float]) → tuple[list[float], list[float]][source]¶

Helper function to get ion species densities and charges from a charge map.

Parameters:

charge_map (dict[str, float]) – A dictionary mapping ion species names (e.g., ‘D+’) to their fractional abundance relative to the total ion density.

Returns:

A tuple containing two lists: - The fractional densities of each ion species. - The charge number (Z) of each ion species.

Return type:

tuple[list[float], list[float]]

lawson.py¶

fusioncat.physics.lawson.calculate_coulomb_logarithm(n_e: Quantity, T_e: Quantity) → float[source]¶

Calculates the electron-ion Coulomb logarithm (log Lambda).

This value is a factor in formulas for collisional processes in plasmas.

Source¶

A common approximation found in many plasma physics texts, including the NRL Plasma Formulary.

param n_e:

The electron density.

type n_e:

astropy.units.Quantity

param T_e:

The electron temperature.

type T_e:

astropy.units.Quantity

returns:

The dimensionless Coulomb logarithm.

rtype:

float

fusioncat.physics.lawson.calculate_ion_electron_exchange(n_i: Quantity, T_i: Quantity, n_e: Quantity, T_e: Quantity, V: Quantity, fuel: Fuel) → Annotated[Quantity, Unit('W')][source]¶

Calculates power transferred from ions to electrons via Coulomb collisions.

A positive value indicates net power transfer from ions to electrons (Ti > Te).

Source¶

NRL Plasma Formulary (2019), pg. 34. The implementation uses a simplified formula assuming a single dominant ion species for mass calculation.

param n_i:

The ion density.

type n_i:

astropy.units.Quantity

param T_i:

The ion temperature.

type T_i:

astropy.units.Quantity

param n_e:

The electron density.

type n_e:

astropy.units.Quantity

param T_e:

The electron temperature.

type T_e:

astropy.units.Quantity

param V:

The plasma volume.

type V:

astropy.units.Quantity

param fuel:

The fusion fuel, used to determine average ion mass.

type fuel:

Fuel

returns:

The total power exchanged between ions and electrons in Watts.

rtype:

astropy.units.Quantity

fusioncat.physics.lawson.calculate_triple_product(n: Quantity, T: Quantity, tau_E: Quantity) → Quantity[source]¶

Calculates the fusion triple product (n * T * tau_E).

The triple product is a key figure of merit in fusion research, representing the conditions required for ignition.

Parameters:

  • n (astropy.units.Quantity) – The ion density.

  • T (astropy.units.Quantity) – The ion temperature.

  • tau_E (astropy.units.Quantity) – The energy confinement time.

Returns:

The triple product in units of m^-3 * keV * s.

Return type:

astropy.units.Quantity

particles.py¶

fusioncat.physics.particles.get_ash_charge(fuel: Fuel) → float[source]¶

Helper to get the charge number of the primary ash product.

fusioncat.physics.particles.solve_steady_state_composition(n_i_total: Quantity, T_i: Quantity, tau_p: Quantity, fuel: Fuel, ratio: float = 0.5, enhancement_factor: float = 1.0, max_iter: int = 100, tol: float = 1e-06)[source]¶

Solves for the steady-state plasma composition, including fuel and ash.

This function iteratively solves the particle balance equations for a reacting plasma to find the equilibrium ash concentration and the corresponding fuel dilution.

Parameters:

  • n_i_total (astropy.units.Quantity) – The total ion density to be maintained.

  • T_i (astropy.units.Quantity) – The ion temperature.

  • tau_p (astropy.units.Quantity) – The global particle confinement time.

  • fuel (Fuel) – The fusion fuel being used.

  • ratio (float, optional) – The ratio of the first reactant species to the total fuel ion density, by default 0.5.

  • enhancement_factor (float, optional) – Reactivity enhancement factor for p-B11, by default 1.0.

  • max_iter (int, optional) – The maximum number of iterations for the solver, by default 100.

  • tol (float, optional) – The convergence tolerance for the ash fraction, by default 1e-6.

Returns:

A tuple containing: - The converged ash fraction (n_ash / n_i_total). - The fuel burnup fraction. - The effective charge (Z_eff) of the plasma.

Return type:

tuple[float, float, float]

catalyzed_dd.py¶

fusioncat.physics.catalyzed_dd.solve_catalyzed_dd_composition(n_i_total: Quantity, T_i: Quantity, tau_p: Quantity, max_iter: int = 100, tol: float = 1e-06)[source]¶

Solves for the steady-state composition of a catalyzed D-D plasma.

This function iteratively solves the particle balance equations for the primary plasma species (D, T, He3) and the resulting ash (p, He4). It assumes the tritium and helium-3 produced are burned in situ.

Parameters:

  • n_i_total (astropy.units.Quantity) – The total ion density to be maintained.

  • T_i (astropy.units.Quantity) – The ion temperature.

  • tau_p (astropy.units.Quantity) – The global particle confinement time for all species.

  • max_iter (int, optional) – The maximum number of iterations for the solver, by default 100.

  • tol (float, optional) – The convergence tolerance for the species densities, by default 1e-6.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the converged densities of ‘D’, ‘T’, ‘He3’, the total ‘ash’ density (p + He4), the total ‘fusion_power’ density, and the final ‘z_eff’.

Return type:

dict[str, u.Quantity | float]
